svg.text: 0x0F 77 77 77 - All generators and ports on contactors are alive. 0x0000 1111 0111 0111 0111 0111 0111 0111 Gens B1 B2 B3 B4 B5 B6 Gens - LeftEngineHV / APU1 / EXT / RightEngineHV B1~B6 - reserved zero / 1st port / 2nd port / 3rd port

property.name: script
property.value:
# This is a simple actor that copies the input to the output. # You can remove the ports, add new ports, and modify the script. from ptolemy.data import StringToken from ptolemy.data import IntToken LeftEngineHV = 0x08000000 APU1 = 0x04000000 EXT = 0x02000000 RightEngineHV = 0x01000000 B1 = 0x00700000 B2 = 0x00070000 B3 = 0x00007000 B4 = 0x00000700 B5 = 0x00000070 B6 = 0x00000007
class Main : "Copy the inputs to the output." def fire(self) : token = self.input.get(0) num = int(token.toString()) s = 'FixLeftEngine Result: ' if num & LeftEngineHV: s += 'LeftEngineHV' elif num & APU1: s += 'APU1' elif num & EXT: s += 'EXT' elif num & RightEngineHV: s += 'RightEngineHV' s += ' First Available Port: Port No.' if (num & 0xF) == 2: s += '1' elif (num & 0xF) == 1: s += '2' elif (num & 0xF) == 0: s += '3' else: s += '0' self.output.broadcast(StringToken(s)) return

property.name: script
property.value:
# This is a simple actor that copies the input to the output. # You can remove the ports, add new ports, and modify the script. from ptolemy.data import StringToken from ptolemy.data import IntToken LeftEngineHV = 0x08000000 APU1 = 0x04000000 EXT = 0x02000000 RightEngineHV = 0x01000000 B1 = 0x00700000 B2 = 0x00070000 B3 = 0x00007000 B4 = 0x00000700 B5 = 0x00000070 B6 = 0x00000007
def bin(num): b = '' if num & 0x4: b += '1' else: b += '0' if num & 0x2: b += '1' else: b += '0' if num & 0x1: b += '1' else: b += '0' return b
class Main : "Copy the inputs to the output." def fire(self) : token = self.input.get(0) num = int(token.toString()) s = 'Input Status: ' s += 'PSs: ' if num & LeftEngineHV: s += '1' else: s += '0' if num & APU1: s += '1' else: s += '0' if num & EXT: s += '1' else: s += '0' if num & RightEngineHV: s += '1' else: s += '0' s += ' B1: ' s += bin((num & B1) >> 20) s += ' B2: ' s += bin((num & B2) >> 16) s += ' B3: ' s += bin((num & B3) >> 12) s += ' B4: ' s += bin((num & B4) >> 8) s += ' B5: ' s += bin((num & B5) >> 4) s += ' B6: ' s += bin((num & B6)) self.output.broadcast(StringToken(s)) return

property.name: script
property.value:
# This is a simple actor that copies the input to the output. # You can remove the ports, add new ports, and modify the script. from ptolemy.data import StringToken from ptolemy.data import IntToken LeftEngineHV = 0x08000000 APU1 = 0x04000000 EXT = 0x02000000 RightEngineHV = 0x01000000 B1 = 0x00700000 B2 = 0x00070000 B3 = 0x00007000 B4 = 0x00000700 B5 = 0x00000070 B6 = 0x00000007
def bin(num): b = '' if num & 0x4: b += '1' else: b += '0' if num & 0x2: b += '1' else: b += '0' if num & 0x1: b += '1' else: b += '0' return b
class Main : "Copy the inputs to the output." def fire(self) : token = self.input.get(0) num = int(token.toString()) s = 'Control Result: ' s += ' B1: ' s += bin((num & B1) >> 20) s += ' B2: ' s += bin((num & B2) >> 16) s += ' B3: ' s += bin((num & B3) >> 12) s += ' B4: ' s += bin((num & B4) >> 8) s += ' B5: ' s += bin((num & B5) >> 4) s += ' B6: ' s += bin((num & B6)) self.output.broadcast(StringToken(s)) return

property.name: script
property.value:
# This is a simple actor that copies the input to the output. # You can remove the ports, add new ports, and modify the script. from ptolemy.data import StringToken from ptolemy.data import IntToken LeftEngineHV = 0x08000000 APU1 = 0x04000000 EXT = 0x02000000 RightEngineHV = 0x01000000 B1 = 0x00700000 B2 = 0x00070000 B3 = 0x00007000 B4 = 0x00000700 B5 = 0x00000070 B6 = 0x00000007
class Main : "Copy the inputs to the output." def fire(self) : token = self.input.get(0) num = int(token.toString()) s = 'FixRightEngine Result: ' if num & LeftEngineHV: s += 'LeftEngineHV' elif num & APU1: s += 'APU1' elif num & EXT: s += 'EXT' elif num & RightEngineHV: s += 'RightEngineHV' s += ' First Available Port: Port No.' if (num & 0xF) == 2: s += '1' elif (num & 0xF) == 1: s += '2' elif (num & 0xF) == 0: s += '3' else: s += '0' self.output.broadcast(StringToken(s)) return
